result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antjuan L Weathers Jr

records.addlTxt:
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Juan H.
- Defendant shall not be in the 1900 of S Stoughton Rd in Madison. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

9:28 AM Defendant Antjuan L Weathers Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:42 AM Defendant Antjuan L Weathers Jr not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. State unable to provide evidence of sufficient personal service of notice for hearing. Court rescheduled Initial Appearance, State to issue Summons (or other attempt at service).
